lead_paragraph: The National Basketball Players Association suspended the agent Calvin Andrews for one year. Andrews was accused of recruiting improprieties regarding the former Southern California star O. J. Mayo. Mayo, who played one season at U.S.C. and was drafted third over all by the Memphis Grizzlies, has denied receiving improper funds. Mayo is now represented by Leon Rose, also LeBron James’s agent.
